facts: The world is being devastated by the Blight, resources are very scarce
Cooper is an engineer and a former NASA pilot
Tom and Murph are Cooper's children
Cooper is a widower, he lost his wife to an illness
Murph got a black eye, her family doesn't know it yet but she got suspended from school because she hit Paul after he said anyone who believed humans went to the moon was an idiot
The scene is in a kitchen, inside Cooper's house at night
Tech devices are usually sent to Tyson's for melting down
Donald is pouring a bottle of corn beer into a bubbling vat of chowder.
He turns to watch Cooper work, amused. The probe has been clamped to the kitchen table.
There is a scanner on the table, also a computer with a monitor, and a defibrillator.
Cooper works at the blackened case with a blowtorch.
Cooper gives up -- the torch hasn't made a scratch.
comm_style: Donald is protective of his family
Donald thinks cooper should move on from old technology and space
Cooper is a practical problem solver
Murph is a girl in her teens
Tom is a boy in his teens
Tom is a follower, tends to remain silent
goals: Cooper attempts to find out secrets the probe has, and he sees a plannet in the monitor
Murph wants to know more about the probe and what his dad is learning from it
Cooper doesn't find anything he finds interesting and gives up on the probe
Donald serves the dinner once the probe is out of the way
